linkable_points: Properties within WASD service areas with existing sewer laterals are required to connect to municipal sewer facilities when converting from septic systems, making conversion mandatory rather than optional
Septic to sewer conversion in Miami-Dade typically costs $5,000-$25,000 depending on connection fees, permit costs, septic abandonment, plumbing work, and site conditions

Conversion process requires permits and approvals from five agencies including DRER Sewer Capacity Certification, WASD allocation letter, plumbing permit, Florida DOH septic abandonment permit, and WASD approval with connection fee payment
After paying WASD connection charges, county allows 90 days before beginning sewer billing process, providing grace period for system verification and activation

First required step is obtaining Sewer Capacity Certification Letter from Miami-Dade County DRER Wastewater Section, which verifies sewer main has sufficient capacity and is prerequisite for other permits
Septic tank abandonment requires Florida Department of Health Pump-out and Abandon Permit, with professional pumping and abandonment following proper procedures to prevent environmental contamination

Funding assistance programs available including state and local initiatives providing financial support for septic abandonment and sewer connections, such as programs allocating $800,000 for approximately 13 properties
Professional conversion ensures compliance with Miami-Dade County requirements, proper septic abandonment, correct sewer connection, environmental protection, and successful system activation
